intro: Setilobus vicentinus, commonly known as the Vicentin's set-leaf plant, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its distinctive leaves that are deeply lobed, giving it its scientific name. It produces small, pale yellow flowers that bloom during the dry season. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
